      • Board

        public Board(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
             javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas graphics,

    • Method Detail

      • setCellState

        public void setCellState(int x,
                         int y)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method makes a given cell alive (changing the value to 1)
        Parameters:
        x - and y variables that tells us where the cell is on the board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This is a "helping-method" which contains two main draw-methods. drawGrid draws the grid of the board. drawBoard draws the board's array.

      • getCellSize

        public int getCellSize()

      • sizeChange

        public void sizeChange()
        This method is connected to a slider. Allows the user to select size to the board and drawn cells. The method sets the new size to cellSize, gc clears the board, then draw() is executed. And draws everything to the screen.

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid()
        This method draws the grid of the board. for-loops for X and Y, which adds the size of the cell each iterate to the grid according to the height and width of the Canvas.

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        This method draws the board If the X and Y is equal to 1 there is a living cell.
        Parameters:
        i - is point to X axis
        j - is point to Y axis

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        This method clears the current Board Clears the board first. Then a for-loop that search board for any living cells if true, then set that coordinate [x][y] equal to 0 Draw grid again and stop the Animation.

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        this method updates the board by applying the GoL rules to the board. By using a temporary array that stores the previous state of the board, the next generation of the board is created.

      • neighbours

        public int neighbours(int x,
                      int y)
        This method counts the number of neighbouring cells a given cell has, by iterating through the board with two for-loops that only checks the 8 cells surrounding it.
        Parameters:
        the - x and y coordinates of the cell (placement of the cell in the grid)
        Returns:
        the number of neighbours the cell has.

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard(byte[][] updated)
        This method updates the board by applying the GoL rules, by iterating through the board with two for-loops and assigning 1 or 0 using the GoL rules.
        Parameters:
        the - array which contains the previous generation

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(byte[][] gameBoard)

      • getBoard

        public byte[][] getBoard()
